adr_address: Via Giorgio Washington, 66, 20146 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Stately rooms in an upscale hotel with a lively restaurant & a bar, plus 22 meeting & event rooms.

formatted_address: Via Giorgio Washington, 66, 20146 Milano MI, Italy
name: Milan Marriott Hotel

plus_code.compound_code: F563+CH Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text:
I’ve stayed at many Marriott hotels around the world, and unfortunately this may be one of the worst experiences I’ve had.

At check-in, the receptionist was distracted and unprofessional, which left us confused. She was half checking us in and half chatting with her peers; it took forever with the process. She even told us breakfast was included, only for us to be told the next morning by an even more rude receptionist man that it wasn’t. I honestly wouldn’t have minded paying for breakfast, but the way the situation was handled felt dismissive and unpleasant.

The hotel itself also leaves much to be desired. The location is inconvenient — at least a 10-minute walk to the nearest train stations and far from the city center. On top of that, half the property seems to be under construction, which takes away from any sense of comfort.

The only positive I can mention is that the rooms are fairly spacious for a city hotel. Beyond that, this property is not up to Marriott standards. I won’t be coming back, and I’d recommend spending your holiday money elsewhere.

TL;DR:
•	Inconvenient location
•	Rude, unprofessional service
•	Spacious rooms (the only plus)

The location is fantastic in terms of amenities. There’s an Esselunga grocery store right across from the hotel, along with a pharmacy and a self-service laundry. The metro station is a bit of a walk, but if you top up your ticket or have a day pass, the bus stops directly in front of the hotel. Breakfast is good — they offer three types (express, continental, and American), priced between €16 and €22. The only downside is that the rooms are a little cramped.

The only frustrating part was the lack of food-heating options. There’s no microwave available for guests, and the staff seemed very hesitant to help heat up a simple packet of food I needed for my child.

Milan Marriott Hotel is an excellent property with friendly and professional service. From check-in to check-out, the staff were helpful and welcoming, which made the stay comfortable.

During our visit, the hotel was undergoing renovations, so there was some noise and disruption during the daytime. However, the rooms have already been upgraded and now feature smart, modern designs with high-tech controls that make everything feel fresh and convenient. The renovation efforts are clearly aimed at elevating the overall guest experience.

In terms of location, it’s a bit of a mixed bag. The hotel is about a kilometer from the nearest metro station, so be prepared to walk a little. It is also not in the immediate vicinity of Milan’s major attractions, which might be a drawback for first-time visitors hoping to sightsee with ease. On the bright side, the hotel is right in front of a large supermarket and is surrounded by several restaurant options, which adds convenience for everyday needs.

Overall, I genuinely enjoyed my stay. The service and the good nearby amenities made up for the minor inconvenience of the construction and the slightly distant location. There was nothing I found to fault, and I would consider staying here again.

I enjoyed staying at this hotel and it’s in a great location. Room was newly remodeled and hotel was very nice overall!

Just be sure this hotel meets your needs. As of June 2025 there is no gym, spa, barely a restaurant and just other services you expect at a Marriott in a major city are missing because of construction right now, I know that’s nobodies fault  and remodeling is good but just something to keep in mind. I had a great stay here 👍🏻

The hotel is currently going through renovations so there were some parts which were cordoned off. The gym was basically located in one of the pre-renovated hotel rooms.
Breakfast buffet was served in a hall but they had a good selection of food choices, both hot and cold. Friendly wait staff as well.
The renovated rooms were nice and of a good size. The hotel is not centrally located and is about a 10 minute walk from the two metro stations nearby; Wagner and California.
However, there are plenty of restaurants within waking distance and the big plus is that there's a huge local supermarket just opposite the hotel. Good place to dip in and stock up on the local food stuff.
